chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres L. Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be served in Marathon County

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Andres L. Vasquez in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Andres L. Vasquez in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:59 a.m. State has complied with VWNR. Victim impact statements filed. Agreement stated - Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, 1 yr jail, court costs, 9 days credit for time served. State advises Court of pending case in Marathon Co. Atty Schuster agrees, asks bond be applied to restititution and costs, if any balance, that it be returned to Def at Marathon Co jail, if more owed, asks for civil judgment. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismiss and read in. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 throw/discharge bodily fluid at public safety worker. Counsel heard on sentencing. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. 1 yr jail w/credit for 9 days served, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Apply bond first to $30 restitution, then to costs. If any remaining balance left, return to Def at Marathon Co jail. Jail commences today, may be served in Marathon Co. Voting and firearms restrictions reviewed. Postconviction rights. Discussion if Def still owes after bond applied. Court orders, if able, total costs will be $470, $30 restitution. If Court cannot do this, then convert balance to civil judgment.  Restitution to K. M. R., DA will provide address to COC.
